refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para:
GtkText is deprecated and unsupported. It is known to be buggy. To use it, you must define the symbol GTK_ENABLE_BROKEN prior to including the GTK+ header files. Use GtkTextView instead.
A GtkText widget allows one to display any given text and manipulate it by deleting from one point to another, selecting a region, and various other functions as outlined below. It is inherited from GtkEditable.

refsect2.title: GtkText

warning.para: GtkText is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Most of the GtkText struct members should not be accessed directly. Listed below are a few exceptions and how to use them.

refsect2.title: GtkTextFont

warning.para: GtkTextFont is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Internal GtkText data type.

refsect2.title: GtkPropertyMark

warning.para: GtkPropertyMark is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Internal GtkText data type. Should not be accessed directly.

refsect2.title: gtk_text_new ()

warning.para: gtk_text_new is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Creates a new GtkText widget, initialized with the given pointers to GtkAdjustments. These pointers can be used to track the viewing position of the GtkText widget. Passing NULL to either or both of them will make the GtkText create its own. You can set these later with the function gtk_text_set_adjustment().

refsect2.title: gtk_text_set_editable ()

warning.para: gtk_text_set_editable is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Sets whether the GtkText widget can be edited by the user or not. This still allows you the programmer to make changes with the various GtkText functions.

listitem.simpara: TRUE makes it editable, FALSE makes it immutable by the user

refsect2.title: gtk_text_set_word_wrap ()

warning.para: gtk_text_set_word_wrap is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Sets whether the GtkText widget wraps words down to the next line if it can't be completed on the current line.

listitem.simpara: TRUE makes it word wrap, FALSE disables word wrapping

refsect2.title: gtk_text_set_line_wrap ()

warning.para: gtk_text_set_line_wrap is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Controls how GtkText handles long lines of continuous text. If line wrap is on, the line is broken when it reaches the extent of the GtkText widget viewing area and the rest is displayed on the next line. If it is not set, the line continues regardless size of current viewing area. Similar to word wrap but it disregards word boundaries.

listitem.simpara: TRUE turns line wrap on, FALSE turns it off

refsect2.title: gtk_text_set_adjustments ()

warning.para: gtk_text_set_adjustments is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Allows you to set GtkAdjustment pointers which in turn allows you to keep track of the viewing position of the GtkText widget.

refsect2.title: gtk_text_set_point ()

warning.para: gtk_text_set_point is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Sets the cursor at the given point. In this case a point constitutes the number of characters from the extreme upper left corner of the GtkText widget.

listitem.simpara: the number of characters from the upper left corner

refsect2.title: gtk_text_get_point ()

warning.para: gtk_text_get_point is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Gets the current position of the cursor as the number of characters from the upper left corner of the GtkText widget.

listitem.simpara: the number of characters from the upper left corner

refsect2.title: gtk_text_get_length ()

warning.para: gtk_text_get_length is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Returns the length of the all the text contained within the GtkText widget; disregards current point position.

refsect2.title: gtk_text_freeze ()

warning.para: gtk_text_freeze is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Freezes the GtkText widget which disallows redrawing of the widget until it is thawed. This is useful if a large number of changes are going to made to the text within the widget, reducing the amount of flicker seen by the user.

refsect2.title: gtk_text_thaw ()

warning.para: gtk_text_thaw is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Allows the GtkText widget to be redrawn again by GTK.

refsect2.title: gtk_text_insert ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_text_insert (GtkText *text, GdkFont *font, const GdkColor *fore, const GdkColor *back, const char *chars, gint length);

warning.para: gtk_text_insert is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Inserts given text into the GtkText widget with the given properties as outlined below.

listitem.simpara: the foreground color to insert with
the background color to insert with
the actual text to be inserted
the length of the text to be inserted, passing -1 makes it insert all the text.

refsect2.title: gtk_text_backward_delete ()

warning.para: gtk_text_backward_delete is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Deletes from the current point position backward the given number of characters.

listitem.simpara: the number of characters to delete
TRUE if the operation was successful, otherwise returns FALSE

refsect2.title: gtk_text_forward_delete ()

warning.para: gtk_text_forward_delete is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Deletes from the current point position forward the given number of characters.

listitem.simpara: the number of characters to delete
TRUE if the operation was successful, otherwise returns FALSE

refsect2.title: GTK_TEXT_INDEX()

warning.para: GTK_TEXT_INDEX is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Returns the character at the given index within the GtkText widget.

listitem.simpara: the number of characters from the upper left corner

refsect2.title: The :hadjustment property
refsect2.para: Used by the GtkText widget to keep track of the size of its horizontal text.

refsect2.title: The :line-wrap property
refsect2.para: Boolean value indicating whether line wrap is enabled or not.
Default value: TRUE

refsect2.title: The :vadjustment property
refsect2.para: Used by the GtkText widget to keep track of the size of its vertical text.

refsect2.title: The :word-wrap property
refsect2.para: Boolean value indicated whether word wrap is enabled or not.
Default value: FALSE
